comments:
N20040331.  In talking with Debbie, she said that she would comment out the 
test for now and look for a solution. 
 
 
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError 
 at 
org.eclipse.ui.tests.dynamicplugins.Perspectives.testFindPerspectiveWithId(Perspectives.java:60) 
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
 at 
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

 at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.run(EclipseTestRunner.java:199) 
 at org.eclipse.test.EclipseTestRunner.main(EclipseTestRunner.java:134) 
 at org.eclipse.test.UITestApplication$3.run(UITestApplication.java:180)

 at 
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:106) 
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:2563) 
 at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2268) 
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1558) 
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1532) 
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:257) 
 at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:139) 
 at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:90) 
 at 
org.eclipse.test.UITestApplication.runApplication(UITestApplication.java:123) 
 at org.eclipse.test.UITestApplication.run(UITestApplication.java:55) 
 at

 at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:241) 
 at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:117) 
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
 at 
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) 
 at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
 at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267) 
 at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692) 
 at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)

The failure was caused because the listener in ExtensionEventHandler was being 
called (even though none of the events would be processed by 
ExtensionEventHandler).  Calling this listener caused a syncExec to be 
executed which waited until the UI thread was available to do it's work 
causing the listener that was really doing the work to be delayed too long.  
Eventually, this syncExec will be removed completely (not for 3.0) but for 
now, ExtensionEventHandler has been changed so the syncExec is not called for 
cases covered by the tests.
